metadata.title: CVE-2022-3649 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been classified asproblematic. Affected is the function nilfs_new_inode of the filefs/nilfs2/inode.c of the component BPF. The manipulation leads to use afterfree. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability isVDB-211992.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3649` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-lowlatency - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-aws - 4.4.0-1114.120
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.120').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1').
